trans-unit.source: Class for serializing and deserializing WS-Trust 1.3 RequestSecurityToken (RST) messages.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrust13RequestSerializer"></xref> class.

Checks if the given reader is positioned at a <xref uid="langword_csharp_RequestSecurityToken" name="RequestSecurityToken" href=""></xref> element with the namespace “http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512”.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object from which to read.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the reader is positioned at a RequestSecurityToken element with namespace “http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512”; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
reader is .
Special case for reading <xref uid="langword_csharp_SecondaryParameters" name="SecondaryParameters" href=""></xref> inside a WS-Trust 1.3 RST.
The specification states that a `SecondaryParameters` element cannot be inside another `SecondaryParameters` element.
Override this method to provide custom processing.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object pointing at the <xref uid="langword_csharp_SecondaryParameters" name="SecondaryParameters" href=""></xref> element inside the RST.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that contains the SecondaryParameters found in the RST.

An inner <xref uid="langword_csharp_SecondaryParameter" name="SecondaryParameter" href=""></xref> element was found while processing the outer <xref uid="langword_csharp_SecondaryParameter" name="SecondaryParameter" href=""></xref> element.
Deserializes the RST from an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object to a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
An XML reader over the RST.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object if the deserialization was successful.
There was an error parsing the RST.
Reads a child element inside the RST.
Override of the base class method.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object positioned at an element to read inside the RST.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object that is being populated from the reader.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
reader is .
-or- rst is .
-or- context is .
Unable to deserialize the current parameter.
Writes the supported elements on the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object to the stream.
Override this method if the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken>class has been subclassed and had more properties added to it.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object being serialized.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object to write to.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
rst is .
-or- writer is .
-or- context is .
Serializes the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object into the <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object to be serialized.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object to write to.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
request is .
-or- writer is .
-or- context is .
Writes the specified RST parameter to the outgoing stream.
Override of the base class method.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object to which the RST is being serialized.
The local name of the element to be written.
The value of the element.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object that is being serialized.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
elementName is or an empty string.
